questions.question: What is a dependent variable in an experiment?

choices.answer: a factor that scientists can hold constant in the experiment
the factor that scientists typically manipulate during an experiment
a condition that changes based on other factors in the experiment
a condition that may negatively affect the outcome of an experiment

questions.question: Which answer best states the goal of writing a conclusion in a scientific experiment?

choices.answer: to describe patterns in the data
to make an educated guess
to detail the methods so that other scientists can replicate
to summarize how the results support or refute the hypothesis

questions.question: Why is it important to control variables in a scientific experiment?

choices.answer: so that only one variable is tested at a time
so that the independent variable will remain constant
to control the outcomes so they support the hypothesis
all of the above

questions.question: Which is the most important thing for a scientist to consider when writing a hypothesis?

choices.answer: whether it is valid
whether it will be accepted by peers
whether it addresses the testable question
whether it agrees with the results of prior research

questions.question: Which process will most likely lead to the scientific acceptance of a hypothesis?

choices.answer: revising the original hypothesis
developing a theory based on the data
changing the experimental procedures
duplicating the results of an experiment

questions.question: What are the subatomic particles located in the nucleus?

choices.answer: neutron and proton
proton and electron
neutron and electron
electrons

questions.question: What characteristic is different in each isotope?

choices.answer: the net charge of the nucleus
the position in the periodic table of the elements
the number of neutrons in the nucleus
the mass of the protons in the nucleus

questions.question: Observe the image of the Lithium element. How many electrons does Lithium have?
The electrons determine the chemical reactions of the elements.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: Protons provide stability in the nucleus.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: Which of the following statements about scientific theories is NOT correct?

choices.answer: Theories have been tested many times.
Theories are incomplete, temporary ideas.
Theories can be modified with new scientific evidence.
Theories are strongly supported by evidence.

questions.question: Which of the following questions is testable in a scientific investigation?

choices.answer: Are dogs better pets than cats?
Are cats more active at night than during the day?
Are dogs happy when they are walked?
Are cats easier to take care of than dogs?

questions.question: One possible explanation for jackrabbit population decrease is that the coyote population has increased. This is a...

choices.answer: conclusion
theory
law
hypothesis

questions.question: In order to advance to the level of theory, a hypothesis should be

choices.answer: confirmed at least once.
in alignment with past theories.
a fully functional experiment.
repeatedly confirmed by experimentation.

questions.question: Protons + Neutrons = Atomic Mass

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: # protons = # neutrons = #electrons

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: The atomic number is unique to all elements in the periodic table.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: One atom of iron contains 26 protons, 30 neutrons, and 26 electrons. Which will be possible for another iron atom?

choices.answer: 25 protons, 30 neutrons, 26 electrons
25 protons, 30 neutrons, 27 electrons
26 protons, 28 neutrons, 26 electrons
27 protons, 30 neutrons, 26 electrons

questions.question: Hydrogen gas (H2) is NOT a compound, based on this information what can you infer about hydrogen gas?

choices.answer: It is always compose of one atom.
It is composed of Hydrogen elements chemically bonded.
It is composed of two different elements chemically bonded.
It can easily be broken down into simpler substances.

questions.question: What is a mixture?

choices.answer: Substance composed of two or more elements chemically bonded
Two or more pure substances than can be physically separated
Substance composed of one single element
Two or more substances always uniformly  distributed.

questions.question: Each circle is an atom and each pattern a different element. How many atom do you see?
Each circle is an atom and each pattern a different element. How many different elements do you see?
Each circle is an atom and each pattern a different element. How many different molecules do you see?
Each circle is an atom and each pattern a different element. How many different types of compounds do you see?
Each circle is an atom and each pattern a different element. Is this a mixture?

choices.answer: Yes
Only if they are all the same element
No
Only if they are all molecules
